intro: Adinandra rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated adenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its thick, succulent stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Adinandra rostrata is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic.
